stream_context.summary: Kaze, while feeling ill and fighting a nearly-full SSD, works on the massive overworld for Return to Yoshi's Island. Most of the stream is spent blocking-out Parts 5 & 7 of the hub, brainstorming secrets (caves, rivers, sandcastle blue-coin run) and course entrances (Jurassic Jungle, Koopa Bay, Volcano). He discusses engine changes, ROM size, legal limits, and solicits play-testers.

development_findings.summary: The old hub was scrapped; a single, much larger overworld is being built from scratch, currently ~10 % complete.
development_findings.quote: The original overworld is completely erased… we're making a huge overworld and this is all going to be one level.

development_findings.summary: Current milestone is finishing Part 5 of the hub; Part 4 is temporarily skipped to maintain momentum.
ROM size stands just under 60 MB, leaving limited headroom before the 64 MB hard limit.
development_findings.quote: The size of the ROM is just under 60 MB.

development_findings.summary: Custom step-function eliminates thin invisible walls common in vanilla Mario 64, allowing denser geometry.
development_findings.quote: Hitting an invisible wall just doesn't happen anymore with that unless there's genuinely a big invisible wall.

development_findings.summary: Multiplayer is desired but on hold: boss fights (e.g., Raven) would behave ‘janky’.
development_findings.quote: I don't know if multiplayer is going to be in the game… it's mostly boss fights that are going to be jank with it.

development_findings.summary: Course concepts cemented: 6 = ‘Jurassic Jungle’ with taloned, ancient Yoshis; 8 = Koopa pirate bay; 12 = Volcano reachable after growing a ‘Super Happy Tree’ by collecting happiness.
Design rule: island must feel like ‘secrets around every corner’; new ideas include hidden cave network, grate-blocked river shortcut, and sandcastle blue-coin mini-game.
development_findings.quote: I want the whole island to feel like there's secrets around every corner after all.

development_findings.summary: Planned gating: Volcano entrance (Part 12) locked until player raises the climbable tree; river shortcut blocked by a grate unless a secret is found.
Continuous play-testing strategy: recruit individual testers for single courses to gather granular data.
development_findings.quote: I think I'll get a lot more individual course tests done so that we can get more play-test data.

development_findings.summary: Engine performance: vanilla SM64 engine deemed inefficient; decomp & custom engine allow far more triangles and easier optimization.
development_findings.quote: Whenever someone tells you that programmers used to be better back in the day, just show them the Mario 64 engine code.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is physically ill and repeatedly mentions fever and exhaustion.
context_findings.quote: Today I'm feeling miserable… feeling very feverish.

context_findings.summary: Severe disk-space crisis halts work; he deletes programs and Windows files until Photoshop opens.
context_findings.quote: My hard drive is so full that I can't open Photoshop… we have 5 GB now, we can open the file!

context_findings.summary: Lost historical hack code when an SSD failed; installing new drives is a priority.
context_findings.quote: My old SSD broke and I lost a little bit of work to that… a lot of old hack code that I never uploaded to GitHub.

context_findings.summary: Financial pressure: relies on sponsor videos and hoped for Twitter ad revenue to support family.
context_findings.quote: I gotta make money for my family… Twitch ad revenue really didn't come in like I had hoped.

context_findings.summary: Parenthood goals: wants daughter to enjoy Mario 64; jokes about being the ‘lamest dad’ if she doesn’t.
Philosophy on game design: prefers ‘risky’ creative games over large, safe AAA budgets.
context_findings.quote: Let's start making… simpler games, not just the ‘throw six million dollars at it’ safe type games.

biobak.summary: Spotted geometry asymmetry in Course 2’s disco area; offers feedback.
biobak.quote: Did I make them not square, Biobak? What's wrong?

biobak.summary: Chats briefly about sponsor backlog with Kaze.
biobak.quote: Yeah, I need a bunch of sponsors, Biobak.

zeina.summary: Provided concept art for a spiral cave time-shift idea in Course 6; Kaze reviews it during stream.
zeina.quote: This is what Zeina had, doesn't really work; I do want it to be a cave.

zeina.summary: Leaves mid-stream; Kaze says goodbye and later tries to get chat to praise her ‘Wasabi song’.

key_stories.title: Disk-Space Meltdown
key_stories.summary: Photoshop refused to open because Kaze’s SSD had only 1.6 GB free. Live on stream he deleted miscellaneous programs and Windows cache, ran cleanup tools, and finally freed ~5 GB so work could continue.
key_stories.challenge: Critical lack of disk space blocked asset editing.
key_stories.process: Chat suggestions → manual deletions → Windows cleanup utilities → DISM command → success.
key_stories.outcome: Photoshop opened; resolved for the moment but motivated him to install a new SSD soon.
key_stories.key_quote: Are we really gonna spend the whole stream trying to get like 100 MB on my disk?

key_stories.title: Overworld Re-Architecture Realisation
key_stories.summary: While refining Parts 5 & 7, Kaze realized the lower beach area was meant to be a separate zone. He fused the sections, adjusted course entrances, and introduced new pathways to fix flow issues.
key_stories.challenge: Flat, boring beach and awkward transitions revealed a design oversight.
key_stories.process: Re-examined floor plan → merged areas → relocated Course 8 entrance & pirate star hub → added secret forest loop.
key_stories.outcome: Hub now feels cohesive and central; remaining tasks include Yoshi houses, dunes, and vertical variation.
key_stories.key_quote: This whole bottom area here was supposed to be a different area… Now it all makes sense.
